configuration.name: widget_0879635023931765
configuration.title: Animal Responses to Changes in Temperature
configuration.stem: Think of some behaviors an animal might perform to cool down or warm up. Record the behaviors in the correct box of the feedback diagram.
configuration.teacherAnswer: Student answers to warming behaviors could include moving into the sun or sunning on a rock, shivering, or burrowing in leaves. Student answers to cooling behaviors could include moving out of the sun, panting, and cooling off in water.
configuration.imageAlt: This illustration shows a dog, a lizard, and a bird. Ask your teacher to describe the diagrams to you.
